meanings.definition: The end part of a long bone, initially growing separately from the shaft.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the epiphysis at the end of the bone.
meanings.sent2: The epiphysis of the femur helps in bone growth.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chewed on the epiphysis of the bone, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like the epiphysis of a story, adding a surprising twist.
meanings.sent5: The epiphysis, like a tiny cap, protects the end of the bone.

meanings.sent1: His epiphysis about the solution to the problem came out of nowhere.
meanings.sent2: The epiphysis of understanding dawned on her as she read the last page.
meanings.sent3: The epiphysis of his mistake hit him like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet of the night, the epiphysis of a new idea struck her.
meanings.sent5: The epiphysis of truth illuminated his mind, dispelling all doubts.
